snippet: The number of Afghan soldiers and policemen who have permanent disabilities has soared, overwhelming resources available from the government and charitable organizations.
abstract: Many of the estimated 130,000 members of Afghanistan's army and police force who have been seriously injured or permanently disabled while fighting Taliban insurgents are turning to desperate measures for survival due to inadequate or nonexistent government support.

byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The number of Afghan soldiers and policemen who have permanent disabilities has soared, overwhelming resources available from the government and charitable organizations.
